intro: Phyllanthus micromeris, commonly known as the small-leaved phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect herb or shrub, often with smooth, green stems and elliptical or ovate leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind or water. Phyllanthus micromeris is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
